definition: to capture/to restrain/to constrain/to adhere rigidly to/inflexible
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
to detain (a prisoner)/to keep sb in custody
to detain as criminal/criminal detention/abbr. for 刑事拘留[xing2 shi4 ju1 liu2]
to be a stickler for formalities/to rigidly adhere to/to cling to/constrained/ill at ease
free and unconstrained (idiom); unfettered/unbuttoned/without care or worries
not stick to/not confine oneself to/whatever

sentences.english: Whose feet they hurt with fetters: he was laid in iron
sentences.chinese: 人用脚镣伤他的脚，他被铁链捆拘。

sentences.english: And prince Kunala was exactly the hunter.
sentences.chinese: 今日的拘那罗王子，就是当初的猎师。

sentences.english: No formal charges have been filed against Mr. Hu, who was detained July 5.
sentences.chinese: 胡7月5日被拘，却没有正式起诉。

sentences.english: The three are being held after crossing an unmarked border on a hike.
sentences.chinese: 三名美国人试图穿越未标明的边境进入伊朗时被拘。

sentences.english: Tax fight escalates into Zhejiang riot as 28 are detained .
sentences.chinese: 浙江征税群体性事件28人被拘通报称得到控制。

sentences.english: His application for US citizenship was  subsequently denied, and he was detained after applying to leave America.
sentences.chinese: 其美国公民申请被拒，而后申请离美时被拘。

sentences.english: They bruised his feet with shackles, his neck was put in irons
sentences.chinese: 人用脚镣伤他的脚，他被铁链捆拘。

sentences.english: Wallis, also employed by police as a consultant, was arrested last week in connection with the hacking scandal.
sentences.chinese: 沃利斯还曾担任警方顾问，上周因涉嫌窃听案被拘。

definition: not stick to/not confine oneself to/whatever
the rules and discipline that apply within a family/stick used for punishing children or servants/traditions of an artistic or academic school of thought, passed on from master to pupil
to bring to justice/to punish according to the law
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against
variant of 訓誡|训诫[xun4 jie4]
canon/law/standard work of scholarship/literary quotation or allusion/ceremony/to be in charge of/to mortgage or pawn
